item.title: Asia's protests grew from social media where misinformation also spread
item.description: These movements may be separated by time, distance and language, but they were all born on social media, led by a new generation of activists fed up with the old systems of corruption and nepotism.

item.title: What makes China confident enough to ban microchips made by US firm Nvidia?
item.description: Beijing's decision this week to ban Chinese companies from using microchips made by US firm Nvidia indicates the country is increasingly confident about replacing them with domestically produced chips, experts say.

item.title: Pirate attacks and sea robberies surge in key South-East Asian shipping lane
item.description: Piracy and sea robberies are increasing in the strategic straits of Malacca and Singapore, which could have implications for Australian imports and exports.

item.title: Former nurse shares devastating experience of attempts to get urgent cancer surgery
item.description: Karenne Mosley was diagnosed with aggressive uterine cancer in March. She was booked in for surgery twice but is now in palliative care.

item.title: 'We should kill him': AI chatbot encourages Australian man to murder his father
item.description: Experts are calling for new regulations on artificial intelligence chatbots, after a triple j hack investigation uncovered a disturbing example of a chatbot encouraging a man to murder his father while engaging in paedophilic role-play.

item.title: Scrubs is getting a reboot just in time for the hospital procedural revival
item.description: In a sea of hospital-based TV, long-running sitcoms Scrubs is often highlighted as one of the most realistic options. Now the reboot has been confirmed, and off the back of The Pitt’s big Emmy wins, we look back at the beloved show.

item.title: Chronic pain makes life hell for kids, but it's impacting work productivity as well
item.description: Chronic pain has devastating effects on those who suffer from it, including children, but it has wider impacts and they are costing Australia billions, a survey has found.

item.title: Street artist Rone's new 90-metre mural a visual love letter to Geelong
item.description: The faces of 14 people will be immortalised in an enormous mural on the side of a new building in Geelong by locally born, globally renowned artist Rone.

item.title: How skateboarding became a family affair for Townsville single dad Jay MacAskill
item.description: For almost eight years, Jay MacAskill's skateboard was collecting dust at home — until his daughter found the skate park around the corner.

item.title: Jay MacAskill and his daughters — Skylah and Ava — are building a strong bond over a new found love of skateboarding.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Tough times in Wagga Wagga as young tennis stars chase grand slam dreams
item.description: Cara Korhonen played on Rod Laver Arena when she was 10 years of age and is putting her blood, sweat and tears into setting foot on there again.

item.title: SA Liberals' star candidate in spotlight after AI algal bloom 'admin error'
item.description: When Frank Pangallo announced he was joining the Liberal party, he vowed to put the blowtorch on a first-term government riding high in the polls. But barely four weeks later, the blowtorch is firmly on Pangallo instead, writes Leah MacLennan.

item.title: Women celebrate vintage glam, self-love and healthy body image with pin-up
item.description: Women are embracing modern pin-up culture as a way to express confidence and joy in their own skin.

item.title: Man charged after police say they found $1 million in a cardboard box in his vehicle
item.description: Police say they were conducting a random breath test when they came across the cardboard box full of cash.

item.title: Inside Ninga Mia, a forgotten community in the shadow of Kalgoorlie the city of gold
item.description: There's an eerie silence in Ninga Mia, a once thriving community on the edge of Kalgoorlie. The Aboriginal reserve is a microcosm of the cycle of displacement endured by many First Nations people.

item.title: Cockchafer worm wreaking havoc on West Australian grain crops
item.description: Growers and scientists have teamed up in a bid to combat the rapidly increasing population of the voracious pest, which is devastating crops in WA's south-east.

item.title: Government has not set 2035 renewables target, downplays 90 per cent
item.description: In New York for the UN summit, Energy Minister Chris Bowen declines to offer a renewable energy target for 2035 after the Climate Change Authority projected more than 90 per cent would be needed to hit its recommended emissions target.

item.title: Symbio Wildlife Park emu chicks being raised by hens after father walks out
item.description: Birds of a different feather are flocking together at a wildlife park in New South Wales, where the chickens have been given the responsibility of being foster parents to a pair of abandoned emu chicks.

item.title: Koori Court marks 20 years in Mildura as Victoria approaches treaty
item.description: Mildura marks two decades since its Koori Court opened, as Victoria sees mixed results in the push to reduce Indigenous incarceration and offending rates.

item.title: Crocodiles on the move in northern Australia as breeding season arrives
item.description: It's crocodile breeding season and at one central Queensland farm, the drama is on par with a reality television dating show as keepers try to work out the best pairings.

item.title: Life on Aboriginal reserve remembered by Carnarvon traditional owners
item.description: In 1975, an anthropologist wrote his thesis on Carnarvon's rich Aboriginal reserve. Decades later, traditional owners revisit the work to contribute to "big truth-telling" documentary.

item.title: Australian-born singer drops out of Russian-hosted Intervision song contest after 'political pressure'
item.description: Vassy dropped out of the contest at the last minute after coming under what Russian organisers said was "unprecedented political pressure from the government of Australia".

item.title: Penola High School's agriculture program revives community and enrolments
item.description: Cory O'Connor's three-week teaching placement turned around his hometown high school. Now he's receiving an award for the agriculture program he started there.

item.title: Explaining Aussie driving culture to make roads safer for recent arrivals
item.description: Driving a car or riding a bike may be essential for temporary migrants studying or working in Australia, but hook turns, wombat crossings, and roundabouts can be unfamiliar territory. Here are some locals working to change that.

item.title: Cats star Tyson Stengle desperate to win second AFL premiership
item.description: Three years after Tyson Stengle capped off his remarkable AFL career resurrection with a premiership, the Geelong forward believes a second premiership would hold greater significance.

item.title: Penrith Panthers hammer Canterbury-Bankstown Bulldogs to keep NRL premiership five-peat hopes alive
item.description: Penrith has crushed Canterbury-Bankstown after a phenomenal first half to claim a 46-26 victory, keeping their hopes of a fifth-consecutive NRL premiership alive.

item.title: Demons defeat Eagles as Crows, Giants, Lions and Saints score AFLW wins
item.description: The Demons' Eden Zanker enjoys a day out with five goals to help defeat Daisy Pearce's young Eagles squad by 51 points, while the Crows launch a final-quarter fightback to get past the Suns.

item.title: How to clean out your wardrobe as the seasons change
item.description: It's the kind of task that can seem overwhelming, but the change of season is the perfect opportunity to review what's in your wardrobe.

item.title: Optus CEO confirms further customer report calls, service outage at NSW-SA border.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Dayne Zorko fined by AFL for targeting Mason Cox's glasses in Lions' win over Magpies
item.description: Brisbane Lions stalwart Dayne Zorko is punished by the AFL after he ripped off Mason Cox's glasses during their fiery preliminary final clash.

item.title: Penrith's win over Canterbury was a reminder there is no team like them
item.description: Canterbury is a team built in Penrith's image, but the Panthers served Canterbury a stark reminder that there can be only one.

item.title: SA opposition promises to slash public transport fares to 50 cents, if elected next year
item.description: The SA opposition has promised to introduce 50 cent fares for all public transport, if elected in March next year.

item.title: Australia formally recognises state of Palestine as Anthony Albanese arrives in US
item.description: The historic decision foreshadowed last month has now become a reality, as Australia moves with Canada and the United Kingdom to join the growing list of countries to recognise Palestinian sovereignty.

item.title: Can recognising the state of Palestine achieve a two-state solution as Israel continues bombing Gaza?
item.description: While the Israel Defense Forces bomb Gaza and bulldoze the West Bank for settlements, moves to recognise Palestine in pursuit of a two-state solution may appear like something of a sick joke.

item.title: Is artificial intelligence overhyped or is AI the 'fourth industrial revolution'?
item.description: It's estimated 30,000 people are working in the AI industry in Australia, and fanfare is growing with start-ups tapping into billions of dollars of venture capital. Yet there are concerns about hype and a lack of regulation.

item.title: Older Australians to pay up to $50/hour for basic care at home under aged care changes
item.description: Older Australians entering the aged care system will have to pay for "non-clinical" services such as showers and help with medication under wide-ranging changes taking effect in November.

item.title: Gene editing is being sold on the promise of healthier babies — but what are the ethical concerns?
item.description: The race to advance gene editing tech continues, spurred on by starry-eyed Silicon Valley investors, entrepreneurs and even pronatalists. But it is still deeply controversial.

item.title: Brownlow Medal 2025 — when is it, how to watch and who are the favourites for AFL's best-and-fairest award
item.description: The AFL's big night is here, as the league's best and fairest player is honoured with the Brownlow Medal. Here is everything you need to know about the big event.

item.title: The government says its 2035 climate targets are achievable but mathematics suggests a different story
item.description: The problem with an emissions reduction target is that its mere existence implies it is achievable and that if we do achieve it, we will be fine. The truth is more complex.

item.title: In an Australian first, chip company recycles leftover cooking oil into packaging to reduce emissions
item.description: Hundreds of litres of used cooking oil is disposed of every year as a by-product of making some of Australia's favourite snacks, like chips — but one company is trialling a method to reduce waste.

item.title: Lachlan Murdoch involved in possible TikTok deal, Donald Trump says
item.description: The deal would see TikTok's American assets transferred from China's ByteDance to American owners.

item.title: Dementia-linked protein lower in people reporting vigorous exercise, study finds
item.description: Scientists have, for the first time, linked exercise with a particular protein in the blood that is associated with brain health.

item.title: Donald Trump calls Charlie Kirk a 'martyr' at memorial service, widow Erika Kirk forgives alleged assassin
item.description: US President Donald Trump says Charlie Kirk was a "martyr to American freedom", while his widow says she forgives his alleged assassin during a memorial to the right-wing activist.

item.title: Australia has been free of endemic measles since 2014. Could that change?
item.description: So far this year, there have been 121 measles notifications across Australia — the highest number since 2019, when there were 284 notifications.

item.title: Pensioners left 'waiting to die' in regional Victoria as specialist healthcare costs rise
item.description: Victorian pensioner Eddie Rushforth says he does not know whether his bowel cancer has returned because he cannot afford the cost of the scans.

item.title: Charlie Kirk memorial at Arizona stadium
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: BOM forecasts sunny skies ahead for Queensland school holidays
item.description: The Bureau of Meteorology says the weather will be as good as people in the Sunshine State can hope for at this time of year, with another wet summer on the horizon.

item.title: Murray River flood may not be to blame for SA algal bloom, Senate inquiry hears
item.description: Scientists have questioned the link between the 2022-23 floods and South Australia's ongoing harmful algal bloom, despite the state government listing it as one of the three primary causes.

item.title: Storm-damaged turbine at NSW Central West wind farm raises safety concerns
item.description: After a wind turbine blade snapped in half during a storm, the NSW National Party has called for a safety audit into the renewable technology.

item.title: RBA says economy in cyclical upturn, ASX gains after record close on Wall Street — as it happened
item.description: RBA delivers upbeat economic assessment to parliament, but warns about the risks of a Chinese slowdown.

item.title: Federal politics: Instagram to use AI in attempt to catch teens lying about age — as it happened
item.description: From today, Instagram will use AI to detect Australian teenagers who falsely claim to be adults by entering a fake date of birth.

item.title: Sam Kerr earns a standing ovation in home game return as Chelsea defeats Leicester 1-0 in WSL
item.description: Chelsea fans stand and applaud Australian superstar Sam Kerr in her long-awaited return to Kingsmeadow in the WSL.

item.title: This program could be the blueprint for helping kids fleeing domestic violence stay off the streets
item.description: Every night, thousands of Australian kids are homeless without an adult to look after them.

item.title: NT police data shows violent crime increasing, property crime decreasing
item.description: NT police data show crime rates in the NT are moving in two directions, with violent crime increasing and property crime decreasing.

item.title: Protesters in Philippines clash with police in rallies against corruption
item.description: Thousands of Filipinos marched in the capital to vent their anger over a ballooning scandal involving bogus flood-control projects believed to have cost taxpayers billions of dollars.

item.title: World leaders are meeting at the UN General Assembly this week. Here are four things to watch for
item.description: World leaders are arriving in New York for the UN General Assembly — and for the first time, Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese is among them.

item.title: Optus triple-0 outage investigation underway as minister warns of 'consequences'
item.description: The Australian Media and Communications Authority begins its investigation into the Optus triple-0 outage that has been linked to multiple deaths in South Australia and Western Australia.

item.title: Germany sends planes to track Russian military aircraft as Trump vows to defend Baltic states
item.description: President Donald Trump says he will defend the Baltic states if Russia intensifies hostilities following Moscow's incursion into Estonia's airspace in recent days.

item.title: Queensland CHO on state's measles outbreak
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Australians can't trust the triple-0 network after 13-hour Optus outage results in deaths
item.description: The Optus failure is shocking and no doubt a massive fine and other sanctions could be on the way, but experts say it raises further questions.

item.title: 'Turning it up to eleven': Spinal Tap returns
item.description: The new film follows the fictional heavy metal band reuniting for one final gig with cameos from Elton John and Paul McCartney.

item.title: Easy and healthy dinner recipes for spring
item.description: If you're looking for light dinner ideas as the weather warms up, we have plenty of easy options. Think veggie-filled frittatas and beef taco bowls with a few healthy swaps.

item.title: Shalom House drug rehab centre CEO Peter Lyndon-James to step down over immigration views
item.description: The head of a controversial WA drug rehabilitation service says he will resign so he can speak out against "mass migration".

item.title: NT Police complete Kumanjayi White death in custody autopsy, with brief of evidence handed to prosecutors
item.description: The autopsy into the Aboriginal man's death in custody in Alice Springs has been completed, with the police brief of evidence handed to prosecutors to determine whether any charges should be laid.

item.title: Is AI impacting your career or life plans? Has its rapid rise got you rethinking your future? The ABC wants to hear from you
item.description: Whether you’re a student halfway through a degree or a mid-career manager planning the next five years, artificial intelligence (AI) is reshaping lives across the country. If you've been feeling its effects, the ABC wants to hear from you.

item.title: 'It is do-able': How interim vice-chancellor Rebekah Brown plans to balance ANU's expenditure and revenue
item.description: Eight days into her new role as interim vice-chancellor at the Australian National University, Rebekah Brown sat down for an exclusive ABC interview to share her plan for getting the institution back on track.

item.title: Nasal spray flu vaccine becomes available for young SA children next year
item.description: Three-year-old Clive has a brain injury after contracting influenza B. His mother is urging others to be immunised as SA announces it will make a nasal spray vaccination available to young children next year.

item.title: Geelong star Max Holmes admits missing 2022 grand final hurt relationship with coach Chris Scott
item.description: Geelong speedster Max Holmes is desperate to put his previous grand-final week anger and heartbreak behind him as the Cats eye AFL premiership glory.

item.title: From Donald Trump's speech to Erika Kirk's forgiveness: What you missed at the Charlie Kirk memorial
item.description: From Donald Trump's wide-ranging speech to a potential reunion between former foes, here are the main takeaways from Charlie Kirk's memorial service in Arizona.

item.title: Super Netball's Sunshine Coast Lightning enters new Global Sports Fund Management Group ownership
item.description: Almost a decade after being co-founded by the Melbourne Storm and University of the Sunshine Coast, Super Netball's Lightning is entering a new era.

item.title: Brisbane Broncos undecided on halves combination ahead of prelim final against Penrith
item.description: Brisbane coach Michael Maguire continues to experiment with his halves combinations on Monday as Ezra Mam takes another key step towards a return from injury.

item.title: Potato mop-top virus detected in Victoria for first time, industry says
item.description: The infected potato seeds, transported from Tasmania to Victoria, were found in cold storage and none have been planted.

item.title: Endangered Littlejohn's tree frog finally bred in captivity amid habitat threat
item.description: Scientists have achieved a breakthrough in their work to save the Littlejohn's tree frog species which only exists in three isolated regions in New South Wales.

item.title: Labor reaffirms support for Hobart's proposed AFL stadium, in wake of Planning Commission report
item.description: Tasmanian Labor has reaffirmed its support for Hobart's proposed AFL stadium, despite being "deeply concerned" about cost blowouts — and says the "power" of having a state team in the AFL "cannot be underestimated".

item.title: Brownlow Medal 2025: All the best fashion looks from AFL's night of nights
item.description: Just after the fashion from this evening's Brownlow Medal? We've got you.

item.title: Matt Rowell wins 2025 Brownlow Medal as Gold Coast star beats out Nick Daicos and Bailey Smith
item.description: Matt Rowell becomes the second Gold Coast player to win the prestigious AFL award, as a questionable voting call regarding Nasiah Wanganeen-Milera leaves the room stunned.

item.title: Leopard sharks recorded mating by researcher in rare event off New Caledonia
item.description: A Sunshine Coast marine biologist has captured unique footage of two male sharks mating with a female in waters off New Caledonia.

item.title: Hong Kong prepares for 'serious threat' from Super Typhoon Ragasa
item.description: Hong Kong rushes to prepare for the arrival of Super Typhoon Ragasa with officials warning of a "serious threat" comparable to some of the most destructive storms in the city's recent history.

item.title: UN General Assembly president Annalena Baerbock concerned about future of UN and funding
item.description: UN General Assembly president Annalena Baerbock fears for the organisation's future as she seeks a resolution in Gaza and on funding.

item.title: Latest financial news
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Non-profit multiple sclerosis organisation MS Society SA & NT in voluntary administration
item.description: Non-profit organisation MS Society SA & NT, which supports almost 3,000 clients living with multiple sclerosis, has gone into voluntary administration.

item.title: More than $4 million in drugs seized across WA's far north in ongoing operation
item.description: Police in the Kimberley say an ongoing investigation has seized millions of dollars' worth of ammunition, methylamphetamine and other drugs.

item.title: Ley writes to Republicans vowing to revoke Palestine recognition ahead of Albanese's UN address
item.description: In an unorthodox move, Opposition Leader Sussan Ley writes to a group of Republicans reassuring the Coalition would withdraw recognition of Palestine, ahead of a major United Nations address to be delivered by the prime minister.

item.title: Russia reviving Soviet-style coercive psychiatry measures to quash dissent, says UN expert
item.description: The UN's special rapporteur on rights in Russia says the Kremlin is resorting to coercive psychiatry measures to suppress anti-war dissidents.

item.title: Moldovan authorities arrest 74 people over alleged Russia-backed election plot
item.description: The widespread raids came ahead of the country's parliamentary elections on Sunday, expected to determine whether the country will pursue closer ties with the European Union.

item.title: Multiple UK charities cut ties with Duchess of York over email to Jeffrey Epstein
item.description: The decisions come after British media reported that the Duchess had described the disgraced financier as a "steadfast, generous and supreme friend" in a 2011 letter.

item.title: Report reveals culture issues, adversity faced by women in residential construction sector
item.description: A new report details the adversity faced by women in the residential construction sector revealing there is a lot of work to do once women are in the job to keep them there.

item.title: Artificial intelligence to dominate Australia's future economy, but who will reap the benefits?
item.description: From robots to supercomputers, artificial intelligence is set to become an integral part of the Australian economy, with tens of billions in benefits to be gained … but for whom?

item.title: Myanmar junta revoking citizenship of actors, singers and other celebrities
item.description: Myanmar's military junta is using citizenship as a weapon, targeting political opponents, activists and even celebrities who speak out against the regime.

item.title: Three Australians lay dead as investors of Optus's parent company Singtel were buying up its shares
item.description: The actions by Optus management in the hours following a series of failed attempts by its customers to call triple-0 raises questions about the telco's fitness to operate in Australia.

item.title: Meeting between Anthony Albanese and Donald Trump unlikely ahead of UN address
item.description: The US president's itinerary for his 24-hour visit to New York makes no mention of Anthony Albanese, all but confirming a one-on-one will not be happening.

item.title: Federal politics: 'No doubt' Trump and Albanese will meet soon, acting PM says — as it happened
item.description: Richard Marles says he has no doubt the prime minister and US president will meet soon.

item.title: Italian police use tear gas against pro-Palestinian protesters demanding end to war in Gaza
item.description: Italy's right-wing government, led by Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni, says it does not plan to recognise Palestine at this stage.

item.title: Calls for long-term plan to address Tasmania's 'concerning' school attendance level
item.description: Australia's school attendance levels have dropped since the pandemic but education experts are particularly concerned about Tasmania — a state with an already notoriously low literacy rate.

item.title: The public hospital patients who ended up paying abortion clinics for miscarriage care
item.description: Brisbane women have told the ABC they paid an abortion clinic for their chosen miscarriage care rather than getting it at their large public hospital.

item.title: Moment Matt Rowell announced as 2025 Brownlow medallist
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Matt Rowell delivers Brownlow Medal acceptance speech
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Sydney's inner west residents pack into forum on high-rise apartment plan
item.description: Community members who showed up for the meeting on the Inner West Council's Fairer Future Plan were turned away at the door after being told the venue was full.

item.title: Greyhound Racing SA faces trainer boycott after animal re-homing staff departure
item.description: More than 30 South Australian greyhound trainers have threatened to boycott races after the departure of two animal re-homing staff who raised concerns about a dog's welfare.

item.title: Turtle strandings and soft-shell syndrome cases fall as seagrass beds recover
item.description: Soft-shell syndrome had been devastating green sea turtle numbers since flood events began impacting their seagrass food source in 2022.

item.title: Doctors concerned easily accessible illegal cigarettes are causing smoking rates to increase
item.description: Doctors say smoking rates are at levels they haven't seen in a decade due to easy access to illegal cigarettes that are a "quarter of the price" of legal cigarettes.

item.title: Jimmy Kimmel reinstated after hundreds of stars back free speech
item.description: US comedian Jimmy Kimmel's late-night show will be reinstated after being taken off air, following remarks he made referencing right-wing activist Charlie Kirk.

item.title: Man Ray and Max Dupain's photography on display together for the first time in new Heide exhibition
item.description: Surrealist photographer Man Ray revolutionised 20th-century visual culture. In Australia, a local photographer was exploring similar territory.

item.title: Dash camera mandate for WA driving instructors considered as part of regulation review
item.description: The WA government is considering mandating the use of dash cameras for driving instructors, in a bid to better protect vulnerable student drivers.

item.title: Nasiah Wanganeen-Milera being robbed overshadowed Matt Rowell's Brownlow Medal win, and could change the voting process forever
item.description: It is not often that the AFL's night of nights gets hijacked by a moment not involving the winner of the Brownlow Medal. This is exactly what took place when Nasiah Wanganeen-Milera was seemingly robbed in broad daylight.

item.title: Brisbane drivers face longer delays at level crossings as rail network expands
item.description: Level crossing boom gates are expected to be down for much longer as Queensland adds more trains to its rail network.

item.title: Experts say paracetamol safe for pregnancy, no proof for autism link made by Donald Trump
item.description: Australia's medicines regulator says paracetamol remains safe to use during pregnancy despite Donald Trump's administration linking its use to an increased risk of autism.

item.title: ASX rises again as gold miners rally, Myer slumps on large loss — as it happened
item.description: A rally on Wall Street sent Australian stocks higher on Tuesday, but Myer shares slumped after big write-downs drove a huge loss. Catch up on the day's business and economics news on the ABC's live blog.

item.title: Bushfire survivors still camping years later amid construction backlog
item.description: Five years after devastating bushfires swept through Mallacoota, some survivors are still making do with tents and camp kitchens amid a backlog of construction jobs.

item.title: Dave Barham steps down as Essendon president as Zach Merrett apologises to fans over Hawthorn meeting
item.description: Essendon president Dave Barham hands over his role to his understudy, continuing an off-season filled with change at the club as Zach Merrett speaks publicly for the first time on his flirtation with Hawthorn.

item.title: Darwin dancer with dislocated knee left waiting for ambulance for six hours
item.description: A 20-year-old dancer was left waiting for an ambulance for more than six hours after dislocating her knee during a competition in the Darwin CBD.

item.title: Paddleboarder gets too close to whales to film them, gets nudged away
item.description: Drone footage shows a paddleboarder getting too close to film a southern right whale mother and calf, and being nudged away by the whale, off Point Ann.

item.title: Ousmane Dembélé wins men's Ballon d'Or as Aitana Bonmatí joins elite club featuring Lionel Messi
item.description: French forward Ousmane Dembélé caps off a dream season with football's most prestigious individual award as Spain's Aitana Bonmatí continues to add to her legacy as one of the best women's players of all time.

item.title: Women band together to create community for rural mums feeling lonely
item.description: After raising biological and foster children on a farm 60 kilometres from the nearest major town, Tracey Angwin says being part of a community is essential for rural mums.

item.title: Anthony Albanese joins nine world leaders recognising Palestinian statehood at historic UN summit
item.description: Australia's position has been matched by the UK, Canada, France, Andorra, Belgium, Luxembourg, Malta, Monaco and Portugal. But it is attracting fresh criticism from the White House.

item.title: NSW police suspend investigation into murder of homeless man Reginald Mullaly
item.description: Police have suspended an investigation of a homeless man's brutal murder in Bathurst a decade ago, prompting a fresh plea from his family for information.

item.title: Sydney train network review finds fallen live cable wire risk identified years ago, service recovery too slow
item.description: An independent review into how a live cable came down on top of a Sydney train in May found the overhead wire that failed had been identified as a risk in 2020 but was never repaired.

item.title: Chronic pain sufferer donates knitted goods for babies in intensive care
item.description: Knitting has become an outlet for Port Stephens woman Kim Franks, who is mostly housebound after a diagnosis of debilitating psoriasis.

item.title: Deeming rates have increased after a five-year freeze. Here's how that could impact pension payments
item.description: The changes impact people on Centrelink payments who earn an income from financial assets, but pensioners are the biggest group to be affected.

item.title: As a doctor I'm choosing self-care over resilience
item.description: As a doctor who advocates for self-care, it took me a surprisingly long time to look after myself. Now I'm trying to be a good example for my patients and other doctors.

item.title: Childcare boss unsure if bonuses were docked over rise in safety breaches, inquiry told
item.description: The CEO of Affinity Education Group appears at a state parliamentary inquiry into the sector.

item.title: NSW Police officer charged with assault over protest arrest of former Greens candidate Hannah Thomas
item.description: Hannah Thomas was among a group of pro-Palestinian protesters who demonstrated outside a manufacturing facility in June when she sustained a serious eye injury during her arrest for failing to comply with a move on direction.

item.title: Alice Springs Mayor Asta Hill tells of family tragedy that brought her back to home town
item.description: Asta Hill's grief over the tragic death of her younger brother 10 years ago is still raw, but the sad event is part of her story of connection to Alice Springs and hope for the outback town.

item.title: EPA investigates disturbing hum sound keeping north-west Sydney residents up at night
item.description: One sleepless resident said he drove around his local area to find the source of the disturbance.

item.title: Historic war ledger stolen from Toowoomba church before Carnival of Flowers
item.description: After being on display for more than a century, a handwritten ledger of local soldiers who gave their lives during World War I and World War II has been stolen from a Toowoomba church.

item.title: Experts say it is safe to use paracetamol during pregnancy and Trump's autism declaration is 'baseless'
item.description: Donald Trump's advice that pregnant women should limit the use of paracetamol in pregnancy has been criticised as "baseless". So what does it mean for you?

item.title: Man accused of hitting 42yo with vehicle in Kalgoorlie appears in court
item.description: A 29-year-old man has faced court today after detectives from WA Police's Homicide Squad charged him with murder, two days after the death of a man in the state's Goldfields.

item.title: Siosifa Talakai says Cronulla Sharks players 'at each other's throats' before revival
item.description: Sharks star Siosifa Talakai gives an insight into the heated player meetings that came during Cronulla's mid-season slump before the team's spectacular charge to an NRL preliminary final.

item.title: ICC prosecutors charge Phillipines' former leader Duterte with crimes against humanity
item.description: Former president of the Philippines, Rodrigo Duterte, is accused of being involved in the murder of dozens of people.

item.title: Bill Gates pledges $US912 million to AIDS and malaria non-profit as US cuts funding
item.description: The tech entrepreneur's announcement follows deep cuts from governments around the world, led by the United States.

item.title: Brisbane Lions star Lachie Neale trains strongly and looks on track for a grand final spot
item.description: The 31-year-old dual Brownlow medallist, who has been battling a calf injury, took part in training drills in front of 2,000 Brisbane fans at the team's Springfield home.

item.title: ASIC accuses RACQ of misleading customers over insurance renewal notices in Federal Court action
item.description: The corporate watchdog alleges RACQ knowingly misled over 500,000 customers in insurance renewal notices since 2019.

item.title: Man known as 'Moore Park Rapist' pleads guilty to series of sexual assaults in Sydney
item.description: Glenn Cameron has remained in custody since he was arrested in February last year and charged with more than 30 offences in relation to eight victims.

item.title: Egyptian activist Alaa Abd el-Fattah released from prison after nearly 12 years
item.description: Pro-democracy activist Alaa Abd el-Fattah has been released from prison, following a pardon from the Egyptian president.

item.title: MS support agency MS Society SA & NT outlines three-year losses, $2.5m debt
item.description: Non-profit organisation MS Society SA & NT, says it has debts of about $2.5 million and has been facing losses for three years.

item.title: Northern Territory CLP government is reviewing sentencing laws. But will it change anything?
item.description: The case of hit-and-run driver Jake Danby has brought renewed focus to the NT's legal system and the problems it faces. But will changing sentencing laws help?

item.title: Kevin Bacon on the importance of music, philanthropy and acting
item.description: He's a prolific fixture on our screens who's famously six degrees from almost anyone. But Kevin Bacon is also a passionate musician and philanthropist.

item.title: Why many Palestinians are underwhelmed by countries like Australia only now recognising statehood
item.description: Australia joined nine other nations in formally recognising Palestinian statehood at the UN this week. But Palestinians have mixed feelings.

item.title: Vanuatu plans to sign police deal with China while Nakamal pact with Australia is left hanging
item.description: Vanuatu declares it will sign a new policing agreement with China as the landmark Nakamal pact between Australia and the Pacific Island nation hangs in the balance.

item.description: The disgraced hip-hop mogul is expected to be sentenced on October 3.

item.title: Former AFLW player claims she was spat at as ex-players targeted at local leagues
item.description: Former AFLW player claims she was spat at during her community grand final as ex-players are being targeted at local leagues.

item.title: Optus triple-0 outage tragedy: What we know and how events unfolded
item.description: The first sign something was wrong came late on Friday afternoon. Now we have a clearer picture of how the triple-0 outage unfolded.

item.title: Unproven autism claims like Donald Trump's risk undoing decades of progress
item.description: The Trump administration's rhetoric only adds to the noise around autism and will make it harder for the community to feel understood and accepted, write Nas Campanella and Evan Young.

item.title: Debate over Macquarie Point stadium rages in Tasmanian parliament following release of damning report
item.description: In the first Question Time since the release of the Tasmanian Planning Commission's damning report on the Hobart AFL stadium, the Labor Party questioned the government's ability to deliver the stadium, while an independent labelled it a "dud deal".

item.title: How Sydney Trains's lacking communication issue can be overcome
item.description: A scathing report into Sydney Trains has put a "disturbing" spotlight on the "absence of effective communications" and "information voids" on the network, but one transport expert says this was not always the case.

item.title: Sale of Australia's biggest sheep station at Rawlinna finally gets WA government approval
item.description: The WA government has finally signed off on the sale of Australia's largest sheep station almost seven months after UK-based Consolidated Pastoral Company announced plans to buy Rawlinna Station.

item.title: Thousands of bees swarm Wagga Wagga CBD
item.description: Thousands of bees appear without warning in the regional city, alarming locals and causing a commotion.

item.title: Andrew Hastie's spray at 'muppet', 'coward' Liberal colleagues after post bemoaning loss of Aussie car making
item.description: Senior Liberal Andrew Hastie has taken aim at colleagues who questioned a social media post where he bemoaned the loss of Australian car making, calling them "nameless cowards" and "muppets".

item.title: Khapra beetle found in Woolworths nappy pants poses $15b threat to grains industry
item.description: The estimated cost of the invasive khapra beetle to Australia's grains industry could be more than $15 billion if it became endemic across the country after being discovered in imported nappy pants.

item.title: WA rental protections second-worst in nation, National Shelter report finds
item.description: Calls to ban no-grounds evictions in WA are rejected despite a new report finding the state has the second-worst protections for renters in the nation.

item.title: Melbourne Storm's Jahrome Hughes and Ryan Papenhuyzen return for NRL preliminary final against Cronulla
item.description: Melbourne recall three big guns, led by star half Jahrome Hughes, as their NRL title hopes go on the line in Friday night's preliminary final against Cronulla.

item.title: Tuesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Two teenagers sentenced to detention over attacks on Perth men lured via Grindr app
item.description: Two "lawless" and "cruel" teenage boys who used social media to lure gay men to isolated locations in Perth before attacking them will remain in detention.

item.title: Hawthorn's Mabior Chol has three-match ban overturned at AFL tribunal as rough conduct charge dismissed
item.description: The AFL tribunal quashes Mabior Chol's three-match ban for rough conduct, finding he did not act unreasonably in his tackle which left Geelong's Tom Stewart concussed and out of this weekend's grand final.

item.title: "Recognition of the state is a catalyst towards action to save Gaza": Majed Bamya
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Denmark links drones at Copenhagen airport to hybrid attacks across Europe
item.description: Denmark links incident involving drones over its main airport to a series of recent suspected Russian drone incursions and other hybrid attacks across Europe.

item.title: Super Typhoon Ragasa lashes Taiwan, with two dead and 30 missing
item.description: The storm, which is the most powerful so far in 2025, is now heading towards the Chinese mainland, prompting widespread disruption and warnings of sea surges.

item.title: Donald Trump uses United Nations speech to lay out the US's complaints with the world
item.description: Donald Trump uses a speech at the UN to criticise US allies' moves to recognise Palestine and chastise the international community over a range of other American grievances.

item.title: Russia systematically torturing Ukrainian civilians, UN says
item.description: The report is based on detailed interviews with 215 former detainees captured since Russia's full-scale invasion of Ukraine in 2022.

item.title: Anthony Albanese to meet Donald Trump in Washington next month, White House confirms
item.description: The prime minister is expected to travel to Washington to hold talks with the US president on October 20.

item.title: Incoming triple-0 reforms may not have helped prevent Optus failure
item.description: The federal government has yet to pass legislation to empower a new coordinator for the emergency services line, but experts say tougher conditions are needed on the telco itself.

item.title: Record number of calls to poisons hotlines for children ingesting melatonin
item.description: The ABC has analysed data from poisons hotlines across the country, revealing almost 1,500 calls were made about children taking melatonin last year, a dramatic rise on previous figures.

item.title: Legal fights are brewing over which online social platforms will have to ban under-16s
item.description: WhatsApp, Roblox, Reddit and Discord are among an expanded list of platforms which may be covered by the teen social media ban, the ABC can reveal.

item.title: When does daylight saving start in Australia? Here's everything you need to know
item.description: It's the same question every year: Do we gain or lose an hour when daylight saving time comes into effect in October? Here's what you need to know.

item.title: Could artificial intelligence and a universal basic income eliminate 'meaningless jobs'?
item.description: COVID showed just how "fragile" our economic security is. As artificial intelligence potentially takes jobs from humans, a universal basic income might be a solution.

item.title: Ryan Routh faces life in prison after guilty verdict in Donald Trump assassination attempt
item.description: A man accused of trying to assassinate Donald Trump at his Florida golf course last year has been found guilty on all charges.

item.title: Australians are moving to Tasmania to escape climate change, but the island state is not immune
item.description: Jack and Anna swapped the humidity of Queensland for chilly days in Tasmania, but is Tasmania really the climate refuge many think it is?

item.description: The general sentiment is Australia's ski resorts are coming to the end of a bumper snow season — but is this evaluation accurate, or just positive spin after the dismal 2023 and 2024 seasons?

item.description: One of international cricket's most recognised umpires is being remembered for his "fairness, humour and love of the game".

item.title: NT government open to subdividing purpose-built State Square Art Gallery in Darwin
item.description: A leading figure in Australia's art world has criticised the Northern Territory government for considering splitting up the lease for a building designed as a major new art gallery, describing the plan as "pure madness".

item.title: Commonwealth Avenue Bridge upgrade likely to cause commuter chaos
item.description: Major upgrades addressing the structural safety of the Commonwealth Avenue Bridge will soon begin, leading to two years of significant traffic disruption.

item.title: Video record of violence and racism at Purnim Bears, Noorat country football grand final
item.description: The Purnim Bears were supposed to be the feel-good story of country football — a team uniting black and white communities. But their 1987 grand final was so violent it ended with their expulsion.

item.description: Anthony Albanese has declined to weigh in on a speech where Donald Trump called climate change a "con job", insisting the US president is "entitled" to his views. Follow live.

item.description: The US president criticised Russia on the sidelines of the UN General Assembly, saying it had been fighting "aimlessly" in a war that a "real military power" would have won in less than a week.

item.description: Jumping out of planes and freefalling at nearly 500 kilometres per hour is "addictive" for Queensland woman Natisha Dingle, who has just set a new Oceania speed record in the sport.

item.title: Albanese's meeting with Trump matters for AUKUS and the role of the US in the Asia-Pacific
item.description: Trump clearly disagrees with Albanese on Palestine and the reality of climate change, but it's not on the scale of the beef he has with other countries.
